A good product is one that meets the needs of the user, is well-made, and functions as intended. It is often durable, reliable, and provides value for the price paid. However, what constitutes a good product is subjective and depends on individual preferences and requirements.
Here are some qualities that make a product good:
Reliability: The probability that a product will perform its intended function adequately for a specified period of time. 
Intuitive usability: A product that is easy to use and makes the user's life simpler. 
Consistent delivery: Consistency in both what you offer and how you deliver it is the key to repeat business. 
Full product: Includes everything that is required to complete the product. 
Value proposition: Details what you offer customers and why they should choose you. 
When recommending a product, it is good to use social proof, such as ratings and reviews, to prove that the product has been appreciated by others.

Performance:seems like a good mouse except one important features

It doesn't have a charging port, so I have to keep exchanging the battery when it runs out or have a SEPARATE AA battery charger. I chatted with the shop about it and that's exactly what they told me to do. If you don't mind about that, then yes, it's a very good mouse, and the seller keeps you updated with each progress of the delivery until it reaches you. Overall, a good product, but a missing charging port for me is a big deal

Overall, its too good value for money!

The Japanese slipper, also known as â€œzoriâ€ or â€œgeta,â€ is a traditional and stylish footwear option that combines comfort with cultural significance. Made from materials like wood, straw, or fabric, these slippers are lightweight and breathable, making them ideal for both indoor and outdoor use. Their unique design, often featuring a thong-style strap, promotes proper posture and encourages natural foot alignment. Modern variations are available in a variety of colors and patterns, catering to both traditional and contemporary tastes. Durable and easy to maintain, Japanese slippers are not only practical but also a beautiful representation of Japanâ€™s craftsmanship and heritage.

Pertama kali beli sambal nyet dan rasanya biasa-biasa sahaja. Saya pernah beli sambal lain di Shopee dan rasa dia lagi sedap berbanding sambal nyet, mungkin sebab takda bahan2 yg biasa ditambah dalam sambal macam ikan bilis, belacan, dsbnya. Biji cili pula agak banyak, mungkin saya personally kalau buat sambal, biji cili akan dibuang sebanyak mungkin. Dari segi label produk, saya rasa cerita rekaan yg ditulis tu kelihatan spt marketing murahan. Cadangan saya lebih baik tulis mengapa sambal ni lain drpd yg lain contohnya. Dan sambal ni tak diretort rasanya jadi tak pasti macam mana ianya boleh tahan agak lama. Semoga ada penambahbaikkan. Terima kasih.
